<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 276, 230, 292]]<|/det|>
## MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[832, 277, 905, 292]]<|/det|>
0580/42  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 301, 243, 316]]<|/det|>
Paper 4 (Extended)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[732, 301, 905, 316]]<|/det|>
February/March 2020  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[745, 325, 905, 341]]<|/det|>
2 hours 30 minutes  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 355, 395, 370]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 384, 400, 400]]<|/det|>
You will need: Geometrical instruments  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 222, 433]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 855, 621]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- You should use a calculator where appropriate.- You may use tracing paper.- You must show all necessary working clearly.- Give non-exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.- For \(\pi\), use either your calculator value or 3.142.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 650, 219, 665]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 666, 730, 698]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 130.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 73, 96, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 72, 339, 89]]<|/det|>
Dhanu has a model railway.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 104, 144, 123]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 103, 611, 122]]<|/det|>
He has a train that consists of a locomotive and 4 coaches.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 120, 705, 139]]<|/det|>
The mass of the locomotive is \(87\mathrm{g}\) and the mass of each coach is \(52\mathrm{g}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 152, 181, 171]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 152, 477, 170]]<|/det|>
Work out the total mass of the train.

<form>............................................ $g$

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 280, 920, 299]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 313, 180, 331]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 312, 834, 331]]<|/det|>
Work out the mass of the locomotive as a percentage of the total mass of the train.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[640, 408, 920, 428]]<|/det|>
<form>............................................ % [1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 441, 146, 460]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 441, 598, 460]]<|/det|>
The train is \(61 \text{cm}\) long and travels at a speed of \(18 \text{cm/s}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 457, 631, 476]]<|/det|>
It takes 4 seconds for the whole of the train to cross a bridge.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 489, 425, 508]]<|/det|>
Calculate the length of the bridge.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[640, 618, 920, 637]]<|/det|>
<form>............................................ $cm$

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 650, 144, 669]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 650, 384, 669]]<|/det|>
A new locomotive costs $64.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 682, 876, 700]]<|/det|>
Calculate the cost of the locomotive in rupees when the exchange rate is 1 rupee = $0.0154 .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 698, 549, 717]]<|/det|>
Give your answer correct to the nearest 10 rupees.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[640, 858, 920, 878]]<|/det|>
<form>................................... rupees

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 858, 920, 878]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 146, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>(d)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 71, 636, 89]]<|/det|>
The cost of a railway magazine increases by \(12.5\%\) to \(\$ 2.70\) .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 103, 586, 121]]<|/det|>
Calculate the cost of the magazine before this increase.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[621, 198, 923, 217]]<|/det|>
<form>$

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[916, 198, 923, 216]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 231, 144, 249]]<|/det|>
<label>(e)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 230, 599, 249]]<|/det|>
Dhanu plays with his model railway from 06 50 to 11 15.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 247, 445, 266]]<|/det|>
He then rides his bicycle for 3 hours.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 280, 707, 298]]<|/det|>
Find the ratio time playing with model railway : time riding bicycle.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 295, 457, 314]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[625, 408, 920, 427]]<|/det|>
<form>....................: .................... [3]

<label>(f)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 440, 510, 459]]<|/det|>
The value of Dhanu's model railway is \(\)550.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 457, 616, 475]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 473, 504, 492]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 71, 485, 89]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 85, 552, 104]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 119, 643, 137]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 312, 410, 330]]<|/det|>

<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 552, 685, 571]]<|/det|>
Water from Manjeet's shower flows at a rate of 12 litres per minute.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 568, 887, 587]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 600, 883, 619]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 71, 611, 89]]<|/det|>

<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 102, 499, 121]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 119, 798, 138]]<|/det|>
[The curved surface area, \(A\), of a cone with radius \(r\) and slant height \(l\) is \(A = \pi r l\).]
